meanings.definition: To change in shape or form.
meanings.sent1: She used magic to transshape the clay into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar will transshape into a butterfly.
meanings.sent3: The wizard accidentally transshaped his hat into a teacup!
meanings.sent4: Time can transshape memories, making them seem different than they were.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hands moved swiftly to transshape the lump of clay into a detailed sculpture.

meanings.definition: The act of changing shape or form.
meanings.sent1: The transshape of the clouds from fluffy to stormy signaled bad weather.
meanings.sent2: The transshape of the landscape after the earthquake was shocking.
meanings.sent3: The transshape of the cake from a circle to a heart made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The transshape of the city skyline at night was like a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent5: The transshape of the caterpillar into a butterfly is a fascinating process to observe.
